who thinks that programming is fun?

Not everything is fun

  • Meetings
  • Tests
  • Documentation
  • Code style

Why some tasks are boring?

  • Does not concern me
  • Result will be seen in undefined future
    • not soon
    • but sooner or later

We could use some extra motivation

help us do tasks from prev. slides

Carrot & Stick

  • We chase carrot
  • we get hit by the stick if we fall behind
  • Typical
  • waterfall model of motivation - resonable but not nececarly best

Motivation

  • What do we know about motivation

Intrinsic motivation

  • Internal
  • Driven by an enjoyment in the task itself
  • No external influence
  • strongest

  • Taksk that you enjoy doing
  • hobbies
  • programming ;)

Extrinsic motivation

  • External
  • Expect an outcome

  • ex. learning language like English
  • taking out garbage
  • movies
  • motivating intrinsic motivation - hell yeah

Intrinsic motivation will be substituted with extrinsic motivation

  • motivating intrinsic motivation - hell yeah

Self-determination theory

  • Edward Deci & Richard Ryan
  • Research on motivation
  • basic needs
  • should satisfy all or most to be motivated

Competence

Need of beeing good in something

  • programming python?

Relatedness

Need of having relations with other people

  • friendship
  • love

Autonomy

Need of being able to make decisions about myself

  • freedom
  • beaing able to make decisions about myself
  • Need of being in control of your life
  • That's why you can't motivate intrinsic

Games

Competence

⇓
Challenges

Relatedness

⇓
Online games

Autonomy

Games are voluntary

Games motivate us really well!

Game

“A series of meaningful choices”

— Sid Meier

  • Sid - creator of Civilization game series
  • definition underlines autonomy

Gamification

“The use of game elements and game-design techniques in non-game contexts”

— Kevin Werbach & Dan Hunter

Game elements

  • Pawns
  • Dice
  • Board
  • Rules
  • Examples of game elements
  • that not all

Points

  • Keep score
  • Win state
  • Progress
  • Feedback
  • Data for game designer

  • "Friendly reporters" point list

We can give points for …

  • code that increases PyLint result
  • code that increases test coverage

Badges

  • Virtual status
  • Provide a goal
  • Provide a guidance what can be done
  • Feedback on what the user cares about
  • Identity within a group

We can give badges for …

  • Sequence of passed tests
  • Chunk of documentation
  • Changeset with number being a prime number

Leaderboard

  • Competition
  • Context progression

… but do we want to have competition in our team?

We can use leaderboard to …

  • Create game of finding and fixing bugs
  • Create code review game

Game-design techniques

  1. Define your objectives
  2. Identify and measure target behaviors
  3. Describe your players
  4. Figure out your cycles
  5. Use the right tools

Don't forget the fun!

Summary

  1. how motivation works
  2. how it relates to games
  3. how to design a gamified system

… what about programming?

Is programming a game?

  • Competence/challenges
  • Relatedness/community
  • Autonomy
